posts.post_content: SCP mentioned paperloss on the rear in their description of this card.  Curious as to why this is omitted from yours.

[quote name="pokerplyr80" post=1812325]SCP mentioned paperloss on the rear in their description of this card.  Curious as to why this is omitted from yours.[/QUOTE]

I think it’s pretty obvious...good luck with the sale

Josh W.

[quote name="pokerplyr80" post=1812325]SCP mentioned paperloss on the rear in their description of this card.  Curious as to why this is omitted from yours.[/QUOTE]


If I omitted the fact that it was probably trimmed would you be as upset about that?  I didn't realize that I had to state every aspect of the card...

If you need better scans then I will get them for you but I'm pretty sure you can see the flaws.
I'm guessing it is more likely that you're acting like my 4 year old and just trying to be difficult and get some type of reaction.  So you succeeded. Good job. You won your game.

I was surprised to see a card listed on this site for twice what it sold for a month ago, with no mention of a major flaw that was probably a big part of the reason it sold for what it did.  I expect to see that on Ebay, but would hope it wouldn't happen here.  I thought I'd ask about it, maybe it was an honest mistake.  If you think my inquiry makes me appear childish I can live with that.
sadly Icould buy a similar card for 400 hundred 6 yrs ago....whatever EFFIN PRESBYTERIAN BOOSTED THESE CARDS UP SO MUCH...yuns are MANUKES !!!!

Helen Keller could see what you pointed out. Infraction given. There was no need for your comments.  

[quote name="pokerplyr80" post=1812398]I was surprised to see a card listed on this site for twice what it sold for a month ago, with no mention of a major flaw that was probably a big part of the reason it sold for what it did.  I expect to see that on Ebay, but would hope it wouldn't happen here.  I thought I'd ask about it, maybe it was an honest mistake.
